context.question_title: Implementing a Cuboid class in Java

categories.name: Syntax & Compilation
categories.description: Code compiles without errors, proper syntax and language conventions, appropriate use of language features relevant to Variables and Data Types, Functions/Methods, Input/Output Operations, Code Organization, Comments and Documentation, Problem Solving Approaches.

categories.name: Logic & Correctness
categories.description: Algorithm correctness, proper implementation of requirements, handles edge cases appropriately, demonstrates understanding of Variables and Data Types, Functions/Methods, Input/Output Operations, Code Organization, Comments and Documentation, Problem Solving Approaches.

categories.name: Output & Functionality
categories.description: Produces expected output format, meets all functional requirements, handles input/output correctly, demonstrates working solution.

categories.name: Style & Documentation
categories.description: Clear variable and function names, proper indentation and formatting, appropriate comments, follows coding best practices.

category_scores.reasoning: The submission is valid Java code that compiles cleanly. It defines the required private fields (l, w, h, color), provides a 4-argument constructor, a no-argument constructor that delegates to the 4-argument one via this(...), and getter methods for all fields. Constructor chaining is correctly implemented, and the overall class structure follows typical conventions.

getSurfaceArea() computes 2*(lw + lh + wh) as 2*(l*w + l*h + w*h), matching the required formula. getVolume() returns l*w*h. All fields are accessible via getters and used correctly in displayInfo. The no-arg constructor properly initializes to (1, 1, 1, "white") by delegating to the 4-argument constructor.

The test program creates two Cuboid objects as required: a default cuboid and a green cuboid with length 8, width 3.5, height 5.9. displayInfo() prints color, dimensions (l, w, h), surface area, and volume. The main method provides a simple, self-contained test program as specified.

Code is clean, well-named, and easy to read. Indentation and formatting are consistent. While there are no explicit comments or JavaDoc, the structure and naming convey intent. Could be improved with basic documentation for API usage.

feedback.overall_comment: Excellent solution. The Cuboid class correctly implements the required data model, constructors (including proper chaining), getters, and the requested calculations for surface area and volume. The test program demonstrates both default values and a customized green cuboid, and the output includes all required information.
strengths: Accurate data modeling with private fields and getters
Correct implementation of getSurfaceArea() and getVolume()
Self-contained test in main that matches the assignment scenario
Output includes color, dimensions, surface area, and volume
areas_for_improvement: Consider adding JavaDoc comments to public methods and class
Add basic input validation (e.g., non-negative dimensions) to strengthen robustness
Optionally implement toString() or a dedicated formatting method to control output formatting more precisely
